meanings.definition: Demand as a precondition for agreement.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will stipulate that all homework must be completed on time.
meanings.sent2: The contract stipulates that payment must be made within 30 days.
meanings.sent3: I stipulate that you must wear a silly hat to enter my imaginary kingdom.
meanings.sent4: Her parents stipulated that she must finish her vegetables before having dessert.
meanings.sent5: The judge stipulated that the defendant must perform community service as part of the sentence.

meanings.definition: Specify as a condition or requirement in a contract or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The job offer stipulates a minimum of five years of experience.
meanings.sent2: The rules stipulate that all participants must wear closed-toe shoes.
meanings.sent3: The recipe stipulates that you must stir the batter exactly 20 times.
meanings.sent4: The law stipulates that all drivers must carry valid insurance.
meanings.sent5: The lease agreement stipulates a maximum of two pets per household.
